hypothesis_content.title: Neutral-to-Bear Transition via DeFi TVL/BTC Price Divergence
hypothesis_content.statement: During NEUTRAL regimes, when Total DeFi TVL (excluding staking) declines >5% over 7 days while BTC price remains within ±3% range, and DEX/CEX spot volume ratio drops below 0.15, transition to BEAR regime occurs within 10 days with 58% probability, favoring short positions on mid-cap DeFi tokens (CRV, GRT).
hypothesis_content.rationale: DeFi capital outflow during price stagnation indicates weakening underlying demand and smart money exit. Low DEX/CEX ratio shows retail disengagement—both precursors to bearish momentum.
entry_conditions: DEX/CEX spot volume ratio < 0.15 for 3 consecutive days
Aggregate open interest change ≤ 0% over 7 days

exit_conditions.take_profit: Regime shifts to BEAR OR target DeFi tokens decline 12% from entry
exit_conditions.stop_loss: DeFi TVL recovers >3% in 3 days OR BTC breaks range high +2%

hypothesis_content.falsification_criteria: More than 45% of signals see NEUTRAL→BULL transition instead, or DeFi tokens outperform BTC by >5% post-signal.
